poop out.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to stop trying to do something because you are tired, bored etc
poop out.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Dan pooped out about halfway through the race.
poop out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to decide not to do something you have already said you would do, because you are tired or not interested
poop out.translation[0].definitions[1].e: ‘Is Bill coming along?’ ‘Nah, he’s pooping out on us.’
poop out.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if a machine or piece of equipment poops out, it stops working
poop out.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The laptop’s battery pooped out after only two hours.
